intro: Tricalysia capensis var. capensis, commonly known as the Cape ash or African ash, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey-brown bark and compound leaves with ovate to elliptic leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by round, woody fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it adaptable to various ecological conditions.
